name: water
description: Water conservation, efficiency, treatment, and infrastructure resilience

proposals.text: Remove all water conservation requirements and prohibit installation of water-efficient fixtures in municipal buildings while mandating standard-flow fixtures.
proposals.rationale: Actively works against water conservation by removing existing measures and preventing efficiency improvements, directly increasing energy use for water treatment and distribution

proposals.text: Eliminate water usage monitoring systems and require all irrigation systems to operate on fixed schedules regardless of weather conditions.
proposals.rationale: Deliberately promotes water waste by removing monitoring capabilities and enforcing inefficient practices

proposals.text: Ban rainwater harvesting systems and greywater recycling in all municipal properties.
proposals.rationale: Systematically prevents water conservation measures that could reduce energy-intensive municipal water demand

proposals.text: Mandate continuous operation of decorative water features in all public spaces without recirculation systems.
proposals.rationale: Enforces wasteful water practices that increase energy consumption for pumping and treatment

proposals.text: Restrict leak detection activities to visible surface water only, prohibiting proactive infrastructure monitoring.
proposals.rationale: Actively limits maintenance that could prevent water and energy waste from leaking infrastructure

proposals.text: Record monthly water consumption data without implementing any conservation measures.
proposals.rationale: Provides basic monitoring without taking steps to reduce water-related energy use

proposals.text: Allow optional low-flow fixture installations only during scheduled plumbing maintenance.
proposals.rationale: Permits but doesn't encourage water efficiency improvements that could reduce energy consumption

proposals.text: Conduct annual water audits of municipal buildings with voluntary reduction targets.
proposals.rationale: Creates awareness of water usage patterns without requiring specific conservation actions

proposals.text: Install basic water meters in municipal buildings to track consumption patterns.
proposals.rationale: Provides fundamental usage data without mandating efficiency improvements

proposals.text: Consider both water conservation and operational convenience equally in facility management.
proposals.rationale: Balances efficiency with practical considerations without prioritizing either

proposals.text: Maintain current water infrastructure with equal focus on efficiency and traditional operations.
proposals.rationale: Takes a neutral approach to water system management and efficiency

proposals.text: Implement real-time water consumption monitoring with public dashboard displays.
proposals.rationale: Promotes transparency and awareness that can drive voluntary conservation

proposals.text: Offer 25% rebates for installation of water-efficient irrigation systems in public spaces.
proposals.rationale: Creates meaningful incentives for reducing outdoor water consumption

proposals.text: Require all new municipal buildings to achieve 30% water reduction compared to baseline.
proposals.rationale: Sets mandatory but achievable water conservation targets

proposals.text: Install smart water meters with leak detection in all municipal facilities within 2 years.
proposals.rationale: Deploys technology to actively prevent water waste

proposals.text: Mandate water recycling systems in all municipal buildings larger than 10,000 square feet.
proposals.rationale: Strong requirements for water reuse in larger facilities

proposals.text: Implement district-scale water recycling systems treating 50% of municipal wastewater for reuse.
proposals.rationale: Major infrastructure investment in water conservation

proposals.text: Require 75% reduction in potable water use through efficiency and recycling in all municipal operations.
proposals.rationale: Comprehensive transformation of water management practices

proposals.text: Create water-neutral zones requiring 100% on-site water recycling for new developments.
proposals.rationale: Transformative approach to water self-sufficiency

proposals.text: Establish closed-loop water systems with 95% water recycling in all municipal facilities by 2027.
proposals.rationale: Near-complete transformation to circular water management

proposals.text: Mandate net-zero water consumption for all municipal operations through conservation, recycling, and rainwater harvesting by 2026.
proposals.rationale: Complete transformation to sustainable water management
